info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER...SOUTHERN VENANGO...SOUTHEASTERN LAWRENCE AND NORTHERN BUTLER COUNTIES THROUGH 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ellwood City, or 7 miles southeast of New Castle, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Shanor-Northvue, Slippery Rock, Prospect, Chicora, Harrisville, Plain Grove Township, Clintonville, West Liberty, Harlansburg, Portersville, and West Sunbury. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 94 and 109. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 34. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
